definition: to cut ties/to disconnect/out of touch
to shed/to take off/to escape/to get away from
to hook/to sew/to crochet/hook/check mark or tick/window catch

sentences.english: The administration has delinked human rights from economic aid to under developed nations.
sentences.chinese: 政府已把人权问题与对不发达国家的经济援助脱钩。

sentences.english: Accredits the personnel wages and welfare and the enterprise gets unhooked, An Jianju direct leadership.
sentences.chinese: 派驻人员工资福利与企业脱钩，受安监局直接领导。

sentences.english: Economic decoupling is not a myth.
sentences.chinese: 经济脱钩，并非一个神话。

sentences.english: Broken strength of arms and tentacula of squid is a significant factor affecting the jigging-off rate.
sentences.chinese: 鱿鱼的腕足断裂强度是影响鱿钓脱钩率的重要因素。

sentences.english: When you catch an object, simply touch the object to unhook it.
sentences.chinese: 当你捕捉的对象，只需触摸对象脱钩了。

sentences.english: Emerging economies reeled and decoupling was ridiculed.
sentences.chinese: 新兴经济体步履蹒跚，“脱钩论”遭到了奚落。

definition: hook (on which to hang sth)/to couple/to link together/to establish contact with/hook/coupling links (e.g. between two railway coaches)
"meals prepared at separate stoves", slogan of the program of fiscal decentralization that began in the 1980s in the PRC
to return to one's original trade/to put (a business etc) under the administration of the relevant central authority/(the) relevant (department in charge of sth)
